name: recirculation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of going around or through something again, or of making something go around or through something again, for a second, third, etc. time: Keeping the knees locked interferes with recirculation of the blood. The re-circulation online of an old newspaper story caused a temporary collapse in the price of the stock.
More examplesFewer examplesClose the air vent in the patient’s bedroom to prevent re-circulation of smoky air.We often work in environments with no natural daylight and where the air is stale from re-circulation.It features a cooled-exhaust gas recirculation engine which offers reduced greenhouse gas emissions.
